ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot of techniques that I hadn't gotten the opportunity to try before. I also learned how to give a good presentation, and how to show what research you have been doing.
Besides the experimentation and presentation skills, I made a lots of friends after rotation.
I really like that we get to have lab rotations so that we can see how we fit into different labs.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the length of the rotations are good. It is nice to be completely finished with our second rotation by Christmas break.

I like how the classes worked out so M/W/F were almost completely dedicated to research (not sure if this was intentional, but it was better that having each day broken up by a class). No complaints, all the professors that I talked to about rotations seemed very nice and very willing to help us out and to help us learn more about the techniques and skills used in their labs.
I love the rotations, it gives us a chance to try out different labs which I know is something not all departments get to do.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. There is no better way to learn about a particular field than to actually do experiments in it. It was also nice to get to try different labs to see what path you liked best.
